author: radekkapka
content: Hello, I'm back with a new question - this time about sync committees. I am not sure why `BeaconBlockBody.sync_committee_bits` and `BeaconBlockBody.sync_committee_signature` are not set anywhere (they are only read from in `process_sync_committee`), and although `SyncCommittee.pubkey_aggregates` is used to create a new `SyncCommittee`, the field is not read from anywhere.

author: radekkapka
content: It feels like something is missing.

author: terence0083
content:
They will be set inside the validator spec (validator.md), which is still yet to be written. 

They just need to sign over the prior beacon block and  coordinate an aggregation that gets to the proposer.

Some of the syntax may have changed, but the basic idea looks like: https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/94ca95f7f0e4f488ca2edf2025a0377319c4e395/specs/phase1/validator.md#light-client-committee
